item.title: R3 Consortium Adds Its First African Bank, Member of Barclays Group
item.description:
R3 Consortium Adds Its First African Bank, Member of Barclays Group

The goal of the R3 Consortium to form a global partnership to design and apply blockchain's distributed and shared ledger-inspired technologies to financial markets got a boost as it adds its first African institution to its membership.

item.title: Bitcoin Price Analysis: Consolidation Ongoing
item.description:
Bitcoin Price Analysis: Consolidation Ongoing

Bitcoin price, as a commodity, criss-crosses its chart range. A reward-halving rally is still possible but is looking more and more unlikely as global commodities sink into a recession quagmire. This analysis is provided by xbt.social with a 3-hour delay. Read the full analysis here. Not a member? Join now.

item.title: Seattle Startup Introduces Twitter Bitcoin Payments
item.description:
Seattle Startup Introduces Twitter Bitcoin Payments

Seattle-based Bitcoin wallet service provider iPayYou has announced the launch of a service which enables users to send and receive Bitcoin payments on Twitter. The service, called Pay-by-Twitter, allows all iPayYou wallet users to send Bitcoin payments to Twitter accounts or handles that are not associated with the iPayYou platform.

item.title: Bitcoin Price Watch; The Weekend Ahead - NEWSBTC
item.description:
Bitcoin Price Watch; The Weekend Ahead - NEWSBTC

Here's a look at what we are focusing on in the bitcoin price this evening, and beyond into the weekend. So that's it - another week done.

item.title: Professor to SEC: Bitcoin Funds 'Like a Penny Stock or Ponzi'
item.description:
Professor to SEC: Bitcoin Funds 'Like a Penny Stock or Ponzi'

Computer science professor Jorge Stolfi has angered bitcoiners with his submission to the SEC regarding a proposed Bitcoin investment fund. Also read: SolidX Files to Become First Bitcoin ETF on NY Stock Exchange As part of its approval process to be listed on the Bats BZX Exchange, details of the COIN ETF were published today in the US Federal Register.

item.title: Ethereum Gets Ready to Hardfork
item.description:
Ethereum Gets Ready to Hardfork

Exchanges, miners, developers, users and ethereum's entire ecosystem is getting ready for a historical and defining hardfork. Kraken, eth's biggest exchange after Polonix, announced traders will be offered only one option, eth on the longest chain. If other exchanges follow Kraken's example, which is likely, a chain split is practically impossible save for, at worst, a couple of hours.

item.title: Under Threat of Ban, Qiwi Says It Has Business As Usual
item.description:
Under Threat of Ban, Qiwi Says It Has Business As Usual

CoinTelegraph has reached Qiwi for comments and they assured us that all necessary actions have been taken to correct information on the website. The largest among payment market players in Russia include, beside Qiwi and Skrill, Yandex.Money, WebMoney, and PayPal. Are their businesses under threat too?

item.title: CME Exec: Bitcoin ETFs Signal Digital Asset Market Maturity - CoinDesk
item.description:
CME Exec: Bitcoin ETFs Signal Digital Asset Market Maturity - CoinDesk

CME Group's executive director and digitization lead has called the increasing number of planned bitcoin exchange-traded funds (ETFs) a sign that the market for blockchain-based digital assets is maturing.

item.title: bitFlyer Charges Huge Commission Fee To Foreigners Buying Bitcoin
item.description:
bitFlyer Charges Huge Commission Fee To Foreigners Buying Bitcoin

Although Japan seems to be warming up to cryptocurrency, it can be quite expensive to purchase Bitcoin. Over in China, people are almost getting used to paying a small premium price on top of the market value. But when people in Japan pay a fee of over 7.4% in commission, things look far less appealing all of a sudden.

item.title: Bitcoin Scam Site Warning - Forex Work
item.description:
Bitcoin Scam Site Warning - Forex Work

Some of the scam sites in the Bitcoin world are taking the more clever approach, albeit that does not mean they are any more legitimate. Forex Work is an interesting platform, even though it is easy to see their HYIP template being used. Moreover,their investment plans offer ridiculous returns, none of which is worth investing money in.
